intro: Oreogrammitis mollipila, commonly known as the velvet fern, is a unique plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the fern family and is characterized by its dense, velvety fronds that give it its common name. The plant has a short, creeping rhizome and produces small, clustered spore-bearing structures called sori. Its foliage is often covered in a fine layer of hair, which helps reduce water loss in arid environments. Oreogrammitis mollipila is adapted to grow in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas with limited moisture.
